title: 103_hr4243
content: The "District of Columbia Building Heights Act of 1994" limits the height of buildings in the District of Columbia. The Act amends regulations on determining maximum building height based on street width and limits on size and height of roof structures in the District of Columbia. The Act amends regulations on maximum building height in the District of Columbia, requiring structures above a certain limit to be fireproof and set back from building walls. The Mayor can waive this requirement if it is unduly restrictive or impractical, without adversely affecting the purpose of the Act or neighboring buildings. The Act increases penalties for violations, with fines now up to $10,000 per day for general violations and up to $100,000 for violations of injunctions. A roof is defined as the top exterior surface of a building, excluding skylights under 5 feet in height. The National Capital Planning Commission's authority to enforce building height limitations is increased. The National Capital Planning Commission's authority is expanded to include approval for roof structures exceeding general limitations in the District of Columbia. The National Capital Planning Commission's authority is expanded to include approval for building heights in the District of Columbia, with a 45-day review period. Members can request approval for building heights, and the Commission can enforce height limitations. The National Capital Planning Commission and its members are granted standing to enforce building height limitations in the District of Columbia as per the Act of 1910. Members can enforce limitations at their own expense unless authorized by the Commission. The National Capital Planning Commission and its members have the authority to enforce building height limitations in the District of Columbia, as per the Act of 1910, at the Commission's expense. The National Capital Planning Commission and its members have the authority to enforce building height limitations in the District of Columbia, as per the Act of 1910, at the Commission's expense. Additionally, a conforming amendment was made to the Act of June 20, 1938, to clarify the standing of the Commission to enforce limitations on buildings and structures in the District of Columbia. The amendments made by this Act will apply to buildings and structures in the District of Columbia for which building permits are issued on or after March 23, 1994.
